Major_Arcs.title: The Human Meteor's First Case
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc encompasses the initial mystery and action involving the Human Meteor, starting from his underwater appearance, transitioning through a taxi ride, car chase, confrontation, and culminating in the discovery of a Japanese submarine and a torpedo plot.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction and Initial Investigation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the Human Meteor and his dual identity as Duke O'Dowd, a cab driver. It sets the stage with an underwater scene and transitions to Duke's civilian life and the beginning of a new mystery with suspicious passengers and a 'G-Man's car'.

narrative_arcs.title: Duke's Taxi Ride to the Waterfront

sub_scenes.title: Yacht Infiltration and Submarine Discovery
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to the yacht where Toby infiltrates and a 'playboy' is thrown overboard. Duke realizes a setup, while Toby's true role is revealed as part of a larger plan involving a submarine. The scene then transitions underwater where Human Meteor discovers a sunken Japanese submarine and the torpedo plot.

narrative_arcs.title: Yacht Deck Work and Cabin Trap
Submarine Plot and Toby's True Role

sub_scenes.title: Underwater Confrontation and Ship Attack
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the underwater confrontation between Human Meteor and divers, escalating from initial encounter to physical conflict and threats. It also shows the Japanese submarine's crew reacting on the surface and Human Meteor's determined attack on the ship above.

narrative_arcs.title: Divers' Initial Encounter with Human Meteor
Human Meteor's Intervention and Divers' Hostility
Human Meteor's Threat and Divers' Retaliation
Discovery of Peter's Condition on Ship
Namor's Determined Final Attack and Ship Crew's Fear

sub_scenes.title: Yacht Investigation and Peter's Exposure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene transitions back to the yacht where Duke, in a boat chase, confronts Peter, who is surprisingly alive. Duke searches Peter's cabin, finds the depth map, and exposes Peter's treachery to an officer, leading to Peter's true identity as Holden and a hospital visit.

narrative_arcs.title: Search for the Depth Map in Peter's Cabin
Exposing Peter's Treachery to the Officer
Evening Reflection after a Chaotic Day
Toby's Home and Invitation to Visit Holden

Major_Arcs.title: Liberty Lads vs. Nazi Spies & Bus Garage Mystery
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new narrative thread focusing on the Liberty Lads fighting Nazis and then transitions to a contemporary mystery involving Skip and Chuck, an ambulance, a dropped wallet, and a bus garage, leading to their abduction and confrontation with Nazi spies.

sub_scenes.title: Liberty Lads Flashback
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene briefly flashes back to a war scene featuring the Liberty Lads in combat against 'Nazi fiends', setting a contrasting tone before transitioning back to the contemporary mystery.

narrative_arcs.title: Liberty Lads in Action Against Nazis

sub_scenes.title: Ambulance and the Bus Garage Lead
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Skip and Chuck and the arrival of an ambulance at a house, sparking their curiosity. They find a dropped wallet leading them to the Transcontinental Bus Company garage and observe unusual activity.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dropped Wallet and the Bus Garage Address
Marine Salutes a Civilian - Major Bronson

sub_scenes.title: Abduction and Interrogation at the Bus Garage
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Skip and Chuck's arrival at the bus garage, their confrontation by a policeman, meeting Mr. Horst, and their subsequent abduction and interrogation, escalating the tension and danger.

sub_scenes.title: Chaos and Rescue at the Bus Garage
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the chaotic intervention and fight at the bus garage, including accusations, threats, the shooting of Major Bronson, and the boys' escape, culminating in Skip seeking help and Chuck encountering a Marine Sergeant.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Sabotage Plans in Secret Office
Resolution and Victory Over Nazi Spies

Major_Arcs.title: The Champ and Henry in South America
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline featuring 'The Champ' and Henry in South America, caught in Nazi intrigue. It follows their arrival, confrontation with soldiers, escape, and discovery of a kidnapping plot involving Rosita.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of The Champ and South American Setting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces 'The Champ' and Henry and shifts the setting to a 'Sleepy South American Town', setting up a new adventure against Nazi spies.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of The Champ and Henry and the Nazi Threat
Setting the Scene in South America and the Soldiers' Search
Confrontation and Fight in the Desert

sub_scenes.title: Military Interrogation and Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the soldiers apprehending and interrogating civilians, including Champ and Henry, who then escape and decide to seek help from the American Consul. The reason for suspicion – Rosita's kidnapping by El Tigre – is revealed.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape and the Decision to Seek the American Consul
Explanation of Suspicion: Rosita's Kidnapping and El Tigre

sub_scenes.title: El Tigre's Kidnapping and Misunderstanding
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces El Tigre, who forces two men into a car, leading them to a house where a woman mistakenly believes they have brought her kidnapped daughter, Rosita, back.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Entry into Car and Commanded Drive
Suspicious Car Ride and Destination Order

sub_scenes.title: Rescue Plan and El Tigre's Hideout Infiltration
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the planning to confront El Tigre and rescue Rosita. It culminates in the infiltration of El Tigre's hideout using stage dollars as a distraction and a direct confrontation with El Tigre.

narrative_arcs.title: Preparation for Action on Tamale Street
Infiltration of El Tigre's Hideout with Stage Dollars

sub_scenes.title: Interrogation and Rescue Operation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene involves the rough interrogation of a man believed to be El Tigre, the search for Rosita, and the eventual discovery of her location, leading to a horseback rescue operation and confrontation with Axis agents.

narrative_arcs.title: Searching for Rosita and Threatening El Tigre
Ride to Headquarters and Rescue Resolve
Citadel Escape and Rear Entrance Strategy
Machine Gun Deployment and Rosita's Intervention

Major_Arcs.title: Devil Dog Dolan's Jungle Mission and Disobedience
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Devil Dog Dolan in a jungle setting, engaging in combat, reporting to superiors, confessing disobedience to orders to save his son, and ultimately facing an ambush and capture, while also revealing his racist justification for arson and the tragic fate of Sam.

sub_scenes.title: Jungle Combat and Reporting
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene starts with Devil Dog Dolan in jungle combat, transitioning to a formal report to a superior officer, hinting at a 'grave matter' and setting up Dolan's subsequent actions and motivations.

narrative_arcs.title: Jungle Combat with Devil Dog Dolan

sub_scenes.title: Jungle Journey and Ambush
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dolan's arrival in the jungle, his exploration and growing unease, and a sudden dart attack and ambush by native warriors, placing him in grave danger.

sub_scenes.title: Capture, Coercion, and Arson
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the aftermath of a jungle conflict, soldiers' suspicion, orders for plans, coercion through torture to obtain sub detector plans, and Devil Dog Dolan's forced compliance and subsequent arson.

narrative_arcs.title: Note Writing and Plan Negotiation under Duress
Devil Dog's Recovery and Plan Acquisition

sub_scenes.title: Marine Attack, Escape Attempt, and Racist Justification
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts the marine attack, Sam's bravery in the fire to help Dolan escape, Grauer's focus on the plans, destruction of native huts, Dolan's fiery escape attempt, and his racist justification for arson, ultimately leading to Dolan's capture and Sam's uncertain fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Native Huts Ablaze Amidst Marine Assault

sub_scenes.title: Jungle Fight and Native Alliance
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Dolan's jungle entrance, a fight with natives leading to the Chief's accidental death, and the subsequent unexpected homage from the natives, culminating in Grauer forming an alliance with them after the native explains their situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Dolan's Jungle Entrance and Initial Encounter
Fight with Natives and Chief's Demise
Grauer's Dialogue with Native and Alliance

sub_scenes.title: Captain's Surrender and Dolan's Discipline
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows the Captain's dilemma and decision to surrender to Grauer's demands, followed by an attack on Sam and a subsequent fight where officers retaliate. It concludes with shore leave being rescinded for Dolan and the Captain administering discipline, yet acknowledging Dolan's 'great deed'.

narrative_arcs.title: Shore Leave Rescinded and Dolan's Discipline

Major_Arcs.title: The Twinkle Twins and the Burgess Murder Mystery
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the 'Twinkle Twins' and their investigation into the murder of banker Robert Burgess. It follows their briefing at the newspaper, investigation at the police station and hospital, discovery of Farnacci's connection, pursuit of Tom Reilly, and ultimately resolves with Farnacci's arrest and a birthday celebration for Reilly's daughter.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Twinkle Twins and Burgess Case Briefing
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the 'Twinkle Twins' and sets up their new case: the murder of banker Robert Burgess, with initial evidence pointing towards Tom Reilly as the suspect.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Twinkle Twins Story
Newspaper Office Briefing on Burgess Murder

sub_scenes.title: Hospital Investigation and Reilly's Condition
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows Dan and Diane's investigation from the police station to the hospital, revealing that Reilly is hospitalized and severely ill, prompting them to visit her and assess her condition.

narrative_arcs.title: Police Station Inquiry about Reilly's Skip

sub_scenes.title: Farnacci Connection and Reilly's Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene uncovers the crucial link to Farnacci through Reilly's blood transfusion need, leading Dan and Diane to investigate Farnacci's racketeering. They learn about Farnacci's gang and a threat to him from Banker Harkell. This leads them to the Irish section to find Reilly, who dramatically escapes from Mrs. Murphy's house.

narrative_arcs.title: Candy Store Phone Call to Elijah about Farnacci
Decision to Locate Tom Reilly in Irish Section
Searching for Tom Reilly in the Irish Section
Mrs. Murphy's Revelation about Reilly and Farnacci

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Confrontation, and Resolution of Burgess Case
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene follows Diane's taxi pursuit of Reilly, which is blocked by a crowd. It then shifts to Reilly's confrontation with gangsters, a street brawl involving locals, police intervention, and the gangsters' arrest. The aftermath reveals Farnacci's arrest, Reilly's daughter's recovery, and a birthday celebration, resolving the Burgess murder case and related conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Reilly's Coal Chute Escape and Diane's Pursuit
Ambulance Transport and Concern for Victims
Failed Blood Donation Match and Community Appeal
Urgent Call for Blood and Community Response
Decision to Arrest Farnacci and Police Action
Police Raid on Poolroom and Arrest
